modules.description: Realizes a translation map by converting a `GettextTypes.t` structure into its optimized `GettextTypes.t'` form, enabling efficient key-based message retrieval. It operates on abstract data types representing translation catalogs, specifically maps of message keys to localized strings. This function is used when loading and preparing translation data for fast lookup during runtime.

This module implements charset conversion for text processing, specifically handling transcoding between different character encodings. It works with strings and encoding identifiers, using a converter structure to manage input and output encodings. Concrete use cases include converting text between UTF-8, ISO-8859-1, and other supported encodings during file or network data processing.

Realizes localization data by converting a `GettextTypes.t` structure into a fully resolved `GettextTypes.t'`, typically used to load and prepare translation catalogs for runtime use. It operates on gettext translation structures, specifically handling message catalogs and locale-specific data. This function is essential when initializing multilingual applications that dynamically load translations based on the current locale.

This module provides a `realize` function that transforms a translation catalog by resolving deferred values into their concrete representations. It operates on hash tables used for efficient lookup of localized strings. A typical use case involves finalizing a catalog after loading translations, ensuring all message identifiers map directly to their translated text.

This module processes and optimizes translation catalogs for efficient message retrieval in multilingual applications. It transforms gettext structures into optimized forms, resolves deferred values, and enables fast key-based lookup of localized strings. Charset conversion is integrated to handle text transcoding between encodings like UTF-8 and ISO-8859-1 during data loading. Example usage includes initializing a translation map for a specific locale, converting message keys to localized strings, and processing translation files across different character encodings.
